LIBRARY PREPARATION PROTOCOL ID (Require: A unique ID for the protocol.
LIBRARY PREPARATION PROTOCOL NAME: A short name for the protocol.
LIBRARY PREPARATION PROTOCOL DESCRIPTION: A general description of the protocol.
PUBLICATION DOI: The publication digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.
PROTOCOLS.IO DOI: The protocols.io digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.
DOCUMENT FILENAME: A filename of a PDF document containing the details of the protocol.
INPUT NUCLEIC ACID MOLECULE (Required): A term that may be associated with a biological macromolecule-related ontology term
INPUT NUCLEIC ACID MOLECULE ONTOLOGY ID: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.
INPUT NUCLEIC ACID MOLECULE ONTOLOGY LAB: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.
NUCLEIC ACID SOURCE (Required): Source cells or organelles from which nucleic acid molecules were collected.
LIBRARY CONSTRUCTION METHOD (Required): A term that may be associated with a process-related ontology term
LIBRARY CONSTRUCTION METHOD ONTOLOGY ID: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.
LIBRARY CONSTRUCTION METHOD ONTOLOGY LAB: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.
END BIAS (Required): The type of tag or end bias the library has.
PRIMER: Primer used for cDNA synthesis from RNA.
NOMINAL LENGTH: Average (insert) size of the fragments being sequenced.
NOMINAL STANDARD DEVIATION: Standard deviation of the (insert) size of the fragments being sequenced.

LIBRARY PREPARATION PROTOCOL ID (Require: Protocol ID should have no spaces.
INPUT NUCLEIC ACID MOLECULE ONTOLOGY LAB: For example: polyA RNA; messenger RNA
NUCLEIC ACID SOURCE (Required): For example: Should be one of: single cell, bulk cell, single nucleus, bulk nuclei, or mitochondria.
END BIAS (Required): Enter 'full length' if there is no tag or end bias. For example: Should be one of: 3 prime tag, 3 prime end bias, 5 prime tag, 5 prime end bias, or full length.
PRIMER: For example: Should be one of: poly-dT, or random.
STRAND (Required): Enter 'first' if sequenced molecule is only the strand generated during first strand synthesis. Enter 'second' if sequenced molecule is only the strand generated during second strand synthesis. Enter 'unstranded' if both strands were sequenced. For example: Should be one of: first, second, unstranded, or not provided.

LIBRARY PREPARATION PROTOCOL ID (Require: FILL OUT INFORMATION BELOW THIS ROW

LIBRARY PREPARATION PROTOCOL DESCRIPTION: Samples were prepared as outlined by the 10x Genomics Single Cell 3′ v2 Reagent Kit user guide. Briefly, the samples were washed twice in PBS (Life Technologies) + 0.04% BSA (Sigma) and re-suspended in PBS + 0.04% BSA. Sample viability was assessed via Trypan Blue (Thermo Fisher) and using a haemocytometer (Thermo Fisher). Following counting, the appropriate volume for each sample was calculated for a target capture of 6000 cells. Samples below the required cell concentration as defined by the user guide (i.e., <400 cells/μl) were pelleted and re-suspended in a reduced volume and counted again using a haemocytometer prior to loading onto the 10x Genomics single-cell-A chip. After droplet generation, samples were transferred onto a pre-chilled 96-well plate (Eppendorf), heat-sealed and reverse transcription was performed using a Veriti 96-well thermal cycler (Thermo Fisher). After the reverse transcription, cDNA was recovered using Recovery Agent provided by 10x followed by a Silane DynaBead clean-up (Thermo Fisher) as outlined in the user guide. Purified cDNA was amplified for 12 cycles before being cleaned up using SPRIselect beads (Beckman). Samples were diluted 4:1 (elution buffer (Qiagen): cDNA) and run on a Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) to determine cDNA concentration. cDNA libraries were prepared as outlined by the Single Cell 3′ Reagent Kits v2 user guide with appropriate modifications to the PCR cycles based on the calculated cDNA concentration (as recommended by 10X Genomics).
